title: Karnataka's New School Push: Mobile Bans on Students Under-16
description: In a bid to address social media addiction among students, Karnataka’s Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has announced plans to ban mobile phones for children under 1
content:
1. Karnataka eyes mobile ban on students under-16; CM Siddaramaiah cites social media addiction  Mint
  2. After Andhra, Karnataka Considers Smartphone Curbs for Students Under 16  NDTV
  3. 'Mobile Bidi Pustaka Hidi': Karnataka’s new school push; teachers urged to cultivate library habits among children  The Times of India
  4. Karnataka mulls mobile ban for students, Siddaramaiah flags social media addiction  India Today
  5. Karnataka Considers Mobile Phone Ban for Children Under 16 Amid Addiction Concerns  Deccan Herald

Conclusion:

In a commendable move to counter the adverse effects of social media on students, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has unveiled plans to ban mobile phones for children under 16 in Karnataka. This initiative not only aims to enhance their focus and study habits but also promotes overall well-being by eliminating distractions. The campaign includes teacher-led sessions aimed at encouraging healthy use of technology and focusing more on reading and written materials, thereby fostering a conducive environment for learning. This forward-thinking measure underscores the importance of balancing modern tools with traditional methods in education.
